df-itgo
blocks.content: A complex number is said to be integral over a subset if it is the root of a monic polynomial with coefficients from the subset. This definition is typically not used for fields but it works there, see ~ aaitgo . This definition could work for subsets of an arbitrary ring with a more general definition of polynomials. TODO: use ` Monic ` . (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 27-Nov-2014.)

blocks.name: df-za
blocks.content: Define an algebraic integer as a complex number which is the root of a monic integer polynomial. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 30-Nov-2014.)

  rexeqdv(s1, cfv(cply, cv(hs0)), cfv(cply, c0), wceq(cv(hs0), c0), wa(wceq(cfv(cv(s1), cv(s0)), nat0), wceq(cfv(cfv(ccoe, cv(s1)), cfv(cdgr, cv(s1))), nat1)))

thm itgoval(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0) {
  ‚ä¢ (c0 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ ‚Üí(IntgOver ` c0)= { s0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` c0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1))})
  ‚ä£ d(s0, s1)
  ‚ä£ d(s0, c0)
  ‚ä£ d(s1, c0)
} = {
  sylbir(c0 ‚äÜ ‚ÑÇ, (IntgOver ` c0)= { s0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` c0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1))}, c0 ‚àà P(‚ÑÇ))
  elpw2(c0, cc)
  fvmpt(hs0, c0, P(‚ÑÇ), citgo, { s0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` c0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1))}, { s0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` hs0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1))})
  rabbidv(s0, cc, hs0 = c0, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` hs0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1)), ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` c0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1)))
  rexeqdv(s1, (Poly ` hs0), (Poly ` c0), hs0 = c0, ((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1))
  fveq2(hs0, c0, cply)
  df-itgo(hs0, s0, s1)
  rabex(s0, cc, ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` c0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1)))
  cnex()
  diff.hs0.c(c0)
  diff.hs0.c(P(‚ÑÇ))
  diff.hs0.c({ s0 ‚àà ‚ÑÇ | ‚àÉ(s1 ‚àà(Poly ` c0),((s1 ` s0)= 0 ‚àß((coeff ` s1)`(deg ` s1))= 1))})
  diff.wceq.s(s0, hs0, c0)
  diff.cv.s(s0, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s0, hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cply, hs0)
  diff.cv.s(s1, hs0)
  diffss.ex(s1, hs0)
  diff.cfv.s(s1, cply, c0)
  diff.cply.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s1)
  diff.hs0.s(s0)
  diff.cc.s(s0)
}

blocks.name: flcidc
blocks.content: Finite linear combinations with an indicator function. (Contributed by Stefan O'Rear, 5-Dec-2014.)
blocks.origin:

  |- wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, c0, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, c2)), csb(s0, c3, c2)))

  -| wi(w0, wcel(c3, c0))

  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s1, w0)
} = {
  a1ii(wi(w0, wceq(csu(s0, c0, co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, c2)), csb(s0, c3, c2))), diffsc(s0, c1))

  eqtrd(co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, c2), c2, co(nat1, cmul, c2), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3))))
  oveq1d(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, c2, nat1, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3))))
  eqtrd(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), nat1, cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3))))

  elsni(cv(s0), c3)

  fsumss(s0, csn(c3), co(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cmul, c2), c0, w0)
  mulcld(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), c2, wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3))))
  syl6eqel(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cc, cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3))))
  eqtrd(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(cv(s0), c3)), cfv(cmpt(s1, c0, cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(cv(s1), c3))), cv(s0)), wa(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3))))
  adantr(w0, wcel(cv(s0), csn(c3)), wceq(cfv(c1, cv(s0)), cfv(cmpt(s1, c0, cif(nat1, nat0, wceq(cv(s1), c3))), cv(s0))))

  ifcli(nat1, nat0, cc, wceq(cv(s0), c3))
